info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 12 at 4:35PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT MONDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Monday. * WHAT... Winds will be out of the west sustained around 10 mph. Smoke from fires in western areas of the state and the two largest fires will tend to drift toward the east through the remainder of the afternoon and evening. Light and more variable wind conditions expected in the vicinity of the Black fire causing the smoke to drift to the areas around Caballo and Hillsboro. Impacts from Midnight fire and Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Fire will be localized and may impact areas around Angel Fire, Taos, Cimmaron and Scout Ranch. * WHERE... Smoke impacts will be localized across portions of Taos, Mora, Grant and western Sierra counties. Elsewhere, brief moderate impacts are expected at times between the Rio Grande Valley and Continental Divide but widespread unhealthy conditions are not expected. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Monday, June 13th
